sentences.english: My guess is that the garbage collector spends a considerable amount of time with collecting memory.
sentences.chinese: 我猜測垃圾回收器話費了相當多的時間去回收內存。

sentences.english: Researchers suspect that most such victims were suffocated to death.
sentences.chinese: 研究人員猜測大部分受害者爲窒息而死。

sentences.english: Teutonic, based on an old Latin quote, or
sentences.chinese: 它來自條頓語，這一猜測基於一條古拉丁語的引述。

sentences.english: The latest de-listing has increasedspeculation that China's holdings will be adjusted down.
sentences.chinese: 最新的退市增加了中國會下調其所持債券的猜測。

sentences.english: Does Liu Hua ever guess the meanings of English words?
sentences.chinese: 劉華猜測英語單詞的意思嗎？

sentences.english: The government is afraid that this might be another terrorist act.
sentences.chinese: 政府方面猜測這也閉O另一波的恐怖行動。

sentences.english: Some speculate that it may be a plesiosaur that survived the rest of the dinosaur population.
sentences.chinese: 一些人猜測這可能是恐龍中存活下來的蛇頸龍。

sentences.english: The user is then asked whether those guesses are good for each search.
sentences.chinese: 然後用戶會被詢問這些猜測是否有助於每次檢索。

sentences.english: The ages of rocks between these two were little more than guesswork.
sentences.chinese: 在這兩者之間的地層年代基本都是靠猜測。

sentences.english: I'm very suspicious that actually Archimedes had been thinking about that problem for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 我猜測，阿基米德實際上已經就此思考了很長時間。

sentences.english: When the couple first dated, there were all kinds of conjectures.
sentences.chinese: 當兩人剛開始約會時，各種猜測便紛至沓來。

sentences.english: To the uninitiated, this approach may sound little better than guesswork.
sentences.chinese: 對於門外漢，這種方法聽起來比猜測好不了多少。

sentences.english: I was right in my conjectures.
The goal is to reduce the guesswork and provide as solid an estimate as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我們的目標是減少猜測，儘可能提供可靠的評估。

sentences.english: This may be related to investor speculation that the company has the intention of re-close.
sentences.chinese: 這可能與投資者猜測，該公司的轉口打算關閉。

sentences.english: Leaf GongJin ZuoShaoQing attempt in speculation.
sentences.chinese: 葉公瑾在猜測左少卿的企圖。

definition: to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
